intro: Cacalia schwenkiifolia, commonly known as the Schwenk's cacalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Cacalia schwenkiifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
